page.title: 05Employment Crosthwaite'area'
page.content: Two workshops provide employment:- {1> CRAFTS}: A man, his wife and an assistant work 20 hours a week involved in woodcrafts and weaving. Many kinds of wood are used to produce bowls, goblets, eggs, lace bobbins, thimbles and other items.The most difficult item made was a spinning wheel.A local farm provides sheeps' wool which is then spun,dyed and woven into bags,rugs and cushions.The workshop is advertised in the parish magazines and goods are sent abroad and to shops and sold to tourists. {2>PRESS-BELLS:}The inventor of the'bus bell,with two assistants,manufactures this press-type bell which is used on buses,as alarm systems in police stations and in factories.These bells can be fitted to any flat surface.They are exported all over the world _ to Australia,Indonesia,Ceylon and Africa.
